attributes.trait_type: cold unsalted butter, cut into small cubes

attributes.value:
Instructions:
Prepare the Dough:

In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt.
Add the cold, cubed butter to the bowl. Using a pastry cutter or your fingertips, work the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs with pea-sized pieces of butter remaining.
Add Liquid Ingredients:

In a small bowl, mix the cold water with the lemon juice.
Gradually add the water mixture to the flour and butter mixture, stirring with a fork until the dough starts to come together.
Form the Dough:

Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead gently to bring the dough together, being careful not to overwork it.
Shape the dough into a rectangle, wrap it in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Roll and Fold the Dough:

Remove the dough from the refrigerator and roll it out on a lightly floured surface into a long rectangle.
Fold the bottom third of the dough up to the center, then fold the top third down over it, like folding a letter.
Rotate the dough 90 degrees and roll it out again into a long rectangle.
Repeat the folding process, then wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Repeat this rolling and folding process 2 more times, chilling the dough for 30 minutes between each fold.
Final Chill:

After the final fold, wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to overnight.
Use or Store:

The puff pastry is now ready to use. You can roll it out and use it in your favorite recipes.
To freeze, wrap the dough tightly in plastic wrap and place it in a resealable plastic bag. Freeze for up to 2 months. Thaw in the refrigerator before using.
(Bubby, these are so easy to fit into any recipe.  Cut them up into little squares and throw em in your freezer)
